H0.text: Stem cells are adult cells in which telomerase is typically active, along with germ cells.

H1.text: Human growth hormone is typically active in germ cells and adult.

H2.text: Chromosomes are the adult structures in which telomerase is typically active, along with germ cells.

H3.text: Sex cells are the adult cells in which telomerase is typically active, just as it is active in germ cells.

A4.text: Stem cells use telomerase, a protein that restores telomeres, to protect their DNA and extend their cell division limit.
